alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 02 at 3:51AM CST until March 05 at 2:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Iowa River at Marengo affecting Iowa and Benton Counties. Iowa River at Wapello affecting Louisa County. Pecatonica River at Freeport affecting Stephenson County. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Iowa River at Marengo. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the levee surrounding Marengo. Water affects low lying agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late this morning.
